definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: For generations its formal teachings were passed down by Daoist priests as well as lay practitioners.
sentences.chinese: 它的教義通過道士和俗家弟子代代流傳了下來。

sentences.english: Several matchmaking events involving Buddhist monks, who are permitted to marry and have families, have taken place in Tokyo.
sentences.chinese: 東京目前已經爲佛教俗家弟子舉辦了多場相親會。

sentences.english: For generations, its formal teachings were passed down by Daoist priests as well as lay practitioners.
sentences.chinese: 它的教義通過道士和俗家弟子代代流傳了下來。

definition: name in religion (of Buddhist or Daoist within monastery)
name in religion (of Buddhist or Daoist within monastery)/same as 法號|法号[fa3 hao4]
the Shaolin monastery and martial arts school
one of three fabled islands in Eastern sea, abode of immortals
square zhang (i.e. unit of area 10 feet square)/monastic room 10 feet square/Buddhist or Daoist abbot/abbot's chamber
to return to normal life (leaving a monastic order)
